page.title: 11Chinnor Cement Works
page.content: The cement works were begun in Chinnor in 1906 because of the availability of chalk and the Princes Risborough to Watlington branch line of the Great Western Railway . It is estimated that local reserves of chalk will last until about 2000 at the current rate of use and then fresh reserves will need to be established. The cement works employs about 110 people in 30 different jobs fulfilling the following functions:quarry diggers, dumper drivers,washmillers,blenders, kiln burners,coal operators,clinker grinders,packers,drivers,mechanics,bulk loaders,fitters,electricians, draughtsmen,timekeeper,storeman, technical engineers,chemists,testers, typists,wages clerks,transport controllers,salesmen,personnel manager, canteen staff,gardeners,general workers,safety officer,and builders.
